menu.description: Train your mind to question, analyze, and validate â€” because in an AI world, your reasoning matters more than ever.
menu.investigation_desc: Each case file contains 5 puzzles. Write your reasoning, get AI feedback.

cognitive.title: Cognitive Training Laboratory
cognitive.subtitle: Train your mind to question, analyze, and validate
cognitive.instructions_text: Examine the data. Look for patterns, anomalies, and relationships. Click on rows to mark points of interest. Sort columns to compare values.
cognitive.analysis_unlock_note: Analysis tools will unlock after the timer.
cognitive.hypothesis_prompt: Based on your observations, propose multiple explanations for what you've seen. Strong reasoning considers multiple possibilities before committing.
cognitive.hypothesis_placeholder: I hypothesize that... because I observed...
cognitive.min_hypotheses: Form at least 2 hypotheses before proceeding
cognitive.interpretation_prompt: What is your interpretation of this data?
cognitive.interpretation_placeholder: Based on my observation and analysis, I believe... However, I'm uncertain about... because...
cognitive.explain_reasoning: Explain your reasoning, not just your conclusion. What evidence supports it? What are you uncertain about?
cognitive.confidence_prompt: How confident are you in this interpretation?
cognitive.uncertainty_prompt: What are you uncertain about and why?
cognitive.uncertainty_placeholder: I'm uncertain about... because the data doesn't clearly show...
cognitive.evidence_contradicts: Evidence will contradict itself. Information will be incomplete.
cognitive.add_note_placeholder: Add a note about this evidence...
cognitive.rate_evidence_first: Rate at least 3 pieces of evidence before proceeding
cognitive.narrative_prompt: Based on the evidence, construct an interpretation of what happened.
cognitive.confidence_affected: Has this challenge affected your confidence?
cognitive.good_reasoning: Good reasoning includes knowing what you DON'T know.
cognitive.name_uncertainties_min: Name at least 2 uncertainties before completing
cognitive.no_win_state: There is NO WIN STATE. Every configuration involves trade-offs.
cognitive.study_connections: Study how the variables connect. Click on variables to see their relationships.
cognitive.continue_exploring: Continue exploring for at least 30 seconds
cognitive.why_change: Why are you making this change?
cognitive.tensions_prompt: This system has fundamental tensions that cannot be resolved.
cognitive.tension_placeholder: Tension: Increasing X requires sacrificing Y because...
cognitive.tradeoff_placeholder: In my configuration, I chose to prioritize X over Y because...
cognitive.final_reflection_prompt: Final Reflection: Why is your configuration defensible?
cognitive.tensions_and_analysis_required: Identify at least 2 tensions and provide trade-off analysis
cognitive.correlation_desc: Check relationship strength between two variables
cognitive.trend_desc: Look for patterns over time or sequence
cognitive.outlier_desc: Identify unusual or extreme data points
cognitive.distribution_desc: Examine shape and spread of data distribution
cognitive.interaction_desc: Test if variables influence each other
cognitive.signal_detection_desc: Observe patterns in noise before acting.
cognitive.system_intervention_desc: Manage trade-offs in a dynamic system.
cognitive.initializing_hypothesis: Data patterns accepted. Initializing Hypothesis Engine...
cognitive.initializing_system: Causal models constructed. Initializing System Intervention...

daily.title: Daily Minigames
daily.all_done_desc: You've completed all daily minigames. Come back tomorrow for new challenges!
daily.daily_limit_reached: Daily token limit reached. Come back tomorrow for more tokens!

0.name: Riddle Marathon
0.description: Classic brain teasers & interview puzzles - test your logic with the world's most famous riddles!

1.name: School Mysteries
1.description: Educational puzzles that test critical thinking and logical reasoning skills.

2.name: Digital Deception
2.description: Learn to detect fake news, scams, and online manipulation tactics.

3.name: Workplace Whodunit
3.description: Navigate office politics and professional decision-making challenges.

4.name: Health & Headlines
4.description: Evaluate health claims and medical information critically.

5.name: Money Mysteries
5.description: Financial literacy puzzles about investments, scams, and money decisions.

6.name: Health & Wellness
6.description: Critical thinking about health, wellness trends, and medical claims.

7.name: Environmental Science
7.description: Evaluate environmental claims and scientific evidence.

8.name: Legal & Justice
8.description: Analyze legal scenarios and justice system puzzles.

9.name: Technology & Privacy
9.description: Navigate digital privacy, security, and technology tradeoffs.

topics.case_files_desc: Each case file contains puzzles. Write your reasoning, get AI feedback.

settings.music_desc: Ambient detective music while you investigate
settings.tip_music: Background music helps create an immersive detective atmosphere. Choose from 7 carefully selected tracks to match your investigation mood!
settings.data_desc: Export, import, or reset your progress data
settings.export_desc: Download your progress data as a JSON file. Use this to backup your data or transfer to another device.
settings.import_desc: Restore your progress from a previously exported JSON file. This will overwrite your current progress.
settings.reset_desc: Permanently delete all your progress data including completed puzzles, scores, and statistics.
settings.premium_preserved: Your premium subscription will be preserved.
settings.reminder_desc: Get notified to practice critical thinking
settings.reminder_time_desc: Choose when you'd like to receive your daily reminder
settings.test_notifications_desc: Send a test notification to see how reminders will look
settings.reminder_tip: Daily practice helps build strong critical thinking habits. Enable reminders to stay consistent with your learning journey!
settings.notifications_blocked: Notifications are blocked. Please enable them in your browser settings.
settings.grant_permission: You'll be asked to grant notification permission when you enable reminders.
settings.browser_not_support: Your browser doesn't support notifications. Please use a modern browser like Chrome, Firefox, or Edge.
settings.password_min_length: Password must be at least 8 characters
settings.2fa_add_security: Add an extra layer of security
settings.scan_qr_desc: Use Google Authenticator or any TOTP app to scan this code
settings.backup_codes_desc: Store these codes securely - you'll need them if you lose your device
settings.one_time_use: Each code can only be used once. Store them securely!
settings.disable_2fa_desc: Enter your password to disable two-factor authentication
settings.tip_never_share: Never share your password with anyone
settings.revoke_confirm: Are you sure you want to revoke this session?
settings.session_tips: These are devices and browsers where you're currently logged in. If you see any suspicious activity, revoke the session immediately and change your password.

auth.sign_in_continue: Sign in to continue your investigation
auth.progress_saved_locally: Your progress will be saved locally on this device
auth.create_track_progress: Create an account to track your progress
auth.terms_agreement: By creating an account, you agree to our Terms of Service
auth.password_min: Password must be at least 6 characters

shop.play_daily: Play daily minigames to earn up to 3 tokens per day!
shop.premium_unlimited: Premium Members get unlimited access to all puzzles!

advanced_analytics.premium_desc: Unlock detailed insights including performance trends, skill type analysis, topic mastery breakdown, learning patterns, achievements, and personalized recommendations!
advanced_analytics.upgrade_note: Also includes unlimited puzzles, priority support, and ad-free experience!
advanced_analytics.no_minigame_data: No minigame data yet. Play some minigames to see stats!
advanced_analytics.complete_puzzles_skill: Complete puzzles to see your skill breakdown!
advanced_analytics.needs_practice: This topic needs more practice to build mastery
advanced_analytics.complete_puzzles_topic: Complete puzzles across different topics to see your mastery!
advanced_analytics.complete_more_puzzles: Complete more puzzles at different times to discover your optimal learning patterns!
advanced_analytics.need_10_sessions: We need at least 10 puzzle sessions to analyze patterns.
advanced_analytics.training_desc: Building critical thinking through productive discomfort
advanced_analytics.complete_training: Complete training sessions to see performance data
advanced_analytics.primitive_desc: These are the core reasoning skills being developed through training:
advanced_analytics.training_data_desc: Complete cognitive training sessions to see your reasoning development analytics here. Training focuses on building critical thinking through Signal Field, Forensic Narrative, and Variable Manifold exercises.

modals.unlock_all_desc: Unlock ALL {{count}} puzzles from this case file
modals.best_value: Best value! Save tokens vs unlocking individually
modals.premium_desc: Get unlimited access to ALL case files and puzzles
modals.tip_unlock: Tip: Unlock entire case ({{count}} tokens) or get Premium for unlimited access to all puzzles!
modals.watch_desc_tokens: Watch a short ad to earn tokens
modals.watch_desc_retry: Watch a short ad to get another attempt at this puzzle
modals.ad_tip_1: Watch the complete ad to earn rewards
modals.ad_tip_2: You can watch up to {{count}} ads per day
modals.privacy_notice: Ads help support this free game. Your privacy is protected.

excavator.title: Assumption Excavator
excavator.mission_desc: Every claim rests on hidden assumptions. Your job is to excavate them. What must be TRUE for this claim to be valid?
excavator.step_2: 2. Categorize - What type of assumption is it?
excavator.step_3: 3. Test - How critical is each assumption? How likely is it true?
excavator.step_4: 4. Report - How fragile is the original claim?
excavator.find_more: Find at least 2 assumptions before proceeding
excavator.test_intro: For each assumption, evaluate: How CRITICAL is it to the claim? And How LIKELY is it to actually be true?
excavator.fragility_question: How FRAGILE is this claim's foundation?
excavator.vulnerability_question: What is the SINGLE biggest vulnerability?
excavator.vulnerability_placeholder: If one thing could break this claim, it would be...
excavator.final_verdict: After excavating these assumptions, do you still believe the claim?
excavator.criticality_q: How CRITICAL is this to the claim? (1=minor, 5=essential)
excavator.likelihood_q: How LIKELY is this assumption to be true?
excavator.cat_value_desc: Assumes what matters or should matter
excavator.prompt_0: What must be true about the WORLD for this claim to hold?
excavator.prompt_1: What must be true about PEOPLE for this to work?
excavator.prompt_2: What does this claim IGNORE or leave out?
excavator.prompt_5: What VALUES or PRIORITIES are embedded?
excavator.prompt_7: Who BENEFITS if we accept this claim uncritically?
excavator.feedback_count: Most claims rest on multiple hidden assumptions. Try to find at least 4.
excavator.feedback_variety: Assumptions come in different types - factual, causal, value-based. Explore different categories.

counterfactual.title: Counterfactual Engine
counterfactual.mission_desc: This outcome happened. But was it inevitable? Explore the causal web that led here, and imagine how things could have gone differently.
counterfactual.step_1: 1. Map Dependencies - What factors led to this outcome?
counterfactual.step_2: 2. Explore Counterfactuals - What if things had been different?
counterfactual.step_3: 3. Analyze Fragility - Was this outcome inevitable or contingent?
counterfactual.causal_question: Question: What factors HAD to be true for this outcome to occur? What was necessary?
counterfactual.identify_3: Identify at least 3 dependencies before proceeding
counterfactual.then_outcome: Then the outcome would have been...
counterfactual.confidence_q: How confident are you in this counterfactual?
counterfactual.create_2: Create at least 2 counterfactuals before proceeding
counterfactual.pivotal_q: What was the PIVOTAL moment or decision?
counterfactual.pivotal_desc: If you could change ONE thing to alter the outcome, what would it be?
counterfactual.pivotal_placeholder: The most critical decision point was...
counterfactual.lessons_q: What does this teach about causation and contingency?
counterfactual.type_sufficient_desc: This alone could cause the outcome
counterfactual.prompt_0: What if the timing had been different?
counterfactual.prompt_1: What if a key person had made a different choice?
counterfactual.prompt_2: What if resources had been allocated differently?
counterfactual.prompt_3: What if information had been available (or hidden)?
counterfactual.prompt_4: What if external circumstances had changed?
counterfactual.prompt_5: What if the sequence of events had been different?
counterfactual.feedback_count: Outcomes typically depend on multiple factors. Try to identify at least 4.
counterfactual.feedback_variety: Different factors play different causal roles. Explore necessary, sufficient, and contributing factors.
counterfactual.feedback_scenarios: Exploring more 'what if' scenarios reveals how contingent outcomes really are.
